    • eagerlyLoadContents

      public FileResource.FileResourceBuilder eagerlyLoadContents(boolean eagerlyLoadContents)
      If the DefaultFileResource object is initialized by a resource string the object can function in two modes; it either loads the contents directly when the object is created using FileResource.afterPropertiesSet() (eagerlyLoadContents = true), or it loads the contents every time it is asked for (eagerlyLoadContents = false). The latter is the default and should be used if large documents that are assigned to several configuration objects are handled. This will prevent a heavy memory usage at the cost of speed in fetching the document contents.
      Returns:
      this.
